title: Boxing legend Oscar De La Hoya denies sexual assault allegation
text:

Boxing legend Oscar De La Hoya has denied allegations of sexual assault having been named in a lawsuit he has labelled "false".

De La Hoya, a six-weight world champion considered amongst the greatest to ever step inside a ring, is being sued by a woman claiming he sexually assaulted her at his home in 2017.

Court documents filed to the Superior Court of the State of California accuse De La Hoya, 46, of sexual assault and battery, gender violence, negligence and the infliction of extreme emotional distress.

The complaint is from an unnamed woman, using the alias "Jane Doe" to protect her identity and seeking damages.

She was 29 at the time of the allegations and in a "consensual sexual relationship" with the former boxer.

De La Hoya's spokesperson labelled the allegations "completely false" and said they "look forward to vigorously defending Oscar's good name and reputation.

(Image: Getty)

The statement read: "A frivolous lawsuit was filed recently alleging that Oscar De La Hoya sexually assaulted ‘Jane Doe,’ which is completely false.

"Oscar is a very successful businessman, running one of the country’s leading sports and entertainment companies – thus a prime target.

"It is worth noting that both recent lawsuits have been filed by the same attorney who is looking to make a name for himself.

"We vehemently deny these allegations and look forward to vigorously defending Oscar’s good name and reputation."

De La Hoya allegedly invited the accuser to his home in Pasadena where she "Believed they would engage in consensual sex", but when she refused a sexual act and "repeatedly said no" it is claimed he became "forceful".

His behaviour is said by court documents to be "extreme, outrageous, and beyond all bounds of decency".

The accuser "has suffered and continues to suffer constant and daily symptoms of depression, anxiety, and related symptoms associated with post-traumatic stress disorder."

She also claims the incident left her with "extreme swelling and pain for which she was prescribed medication at urgent care."
description: Former six-weight world champion and boxing legend Oscar De La Hoya has denied allegations made in a lawsuit
